content: I think I can make it even more engaging by sharing some behind-the-scenes stories about my own experiences in the comedy world. For instance, I could share about how I met a comedian named Rachel at an open mic two weeks ago, and we exchanged numbers to discuss our shared love of comedy writing. Or how I've been taking a comedy writing workshop on Sundays, which has been really helpful in improving my joke structure and delivery. These kinds of stories can help my readers connect with me on a more personal level and appreciate the effort that goes into crafting my comedy sets. What do you think?
